creator: Square Enix (Hironobu Sakaguchi / Yoshinori Kitase / Kazushige Nojima)
work: Final Fantasy series (IV, VI, VII, X)

axioms.name: Every Numbered Entry Is a Reinvention, Not a Sequel
axioms.statement: Each numbered Final Fantasy constitutes a fresh universe, cast, and thematic exploration while maintaining structural and tonal DNA.
derivations: No two numbered entries share world, characters, or direct plot continuity
Recurring elements (Chocobos, Cid, crystals, job systems) as thematic constants, not narrative continuity
Narrative DNA includes: ensemble_cast, emotional_weight, hope_through_loss, mechanical_identity, journey_structure, operatic_register

axioms.name: Emotional Impact Justifies Spectacle
axioms.statement: The primary design criterion for major narrative moments is emotional resonance; technical and narrative spectacle serves to amplify feeling, not replace it.
derivations: Valid spectacle = emotional_impact * technical_achievement
Invalid spectacle = technical_achievement - emotional_purpose
Design priority: Feeling >> Showing

axioms.name: The Party Is More Than One Hero
axioms.statement: The ensemble party functions as a distributed protagonist; narrative weight distributes across multiple characters rather than concentrating in a single figure.
derivations: Each party member has their own arc
Each party member has a spotlight sequence
Each party member has personal emotional stakes
Narrative weight distribution is democratic, not autocratic

axioms.name: Systems Should Feel Like Story
axioms.statement: Mechanical systems express character identity; abilities, battle behaviors, and progression systems encode narrative meaning.
derivations: Limit Break = crisis + identity = moment of truth
Class system = who you are determines what you can do
Progression = growth as character, not just growth as stats
Ability design reflects character background and personality

axioms.name: Loss as Engine, Hope as Destination
axioms.statement: Tragedy propels narrative forward; it does not terminate it. Loss creates vacuum that demands filling with renewed purpose.
derivations: Party member death transforms stakes permanently
World destruction raises stakes to maximum
Identity loss forces psychological reconstruction
Hope is earned through suffering, demonstrated not declared

axioms.name: Operatic Register Is Valid
axioms.statement: High emotion is not excess but essential mode. Melodrama as term of analysis, not dismissal. The JRPG inherits opera's willingness to feel publicly.
derivations: Emotion scale is maximum legible: not subtle but sincere
Dialogue is declarative and emotional
Music includes leitmotif presence
Duration allows emotion to breathe

axioms.name: Music Co-Narrates
axioms.statement: Music is not accompaniment but co-narrator. Uematsu-Sakaguchi collaboration ensures player emotion is guided and sculpted through musical architecture.
derivations: Each major character has identifying musical material (leitmotif)
Character introduction uses theme statement
Character crisis uses minor/slow theme variation
Character triumph uses major/bold theme variation
Party unity interweaves multiple character themes

axioms.name: Spotlight Rotation Distributes Attention
axioms.statement: Each character receives focused narrative attention through systematic rotation, preventing protagonist fatigue and ensuring ensemble investment.
derivations: No character monopolizes attention for too long
Spotlight moments advance personal AND collective arcs
Mechanical relevance often accompanies narrative relevance
Non-spotlight characters remain present but in reactive support mode

levels.name: Thematic Foundation
levels.description: Core theme selection and variation adapted to game world

levels.name: Ensemble Construction
levels.description: Party construction with personal wounds, arcs, and mechanical identities

levels.name: World and Threat
levels.description: Setting and antagonist design that establishes stakes

levels.name: Journey Structure
levels.description: Three-act structure with party assembly, trials, and resolution

levels.name: Operatic Register
levels.description: Emotional mode implementation through dialogue, music, and spectacle

levels.name: Loss and Hope Integration
levels.description: Strategic placement of loss for impact and hope earned through suffering

levels.name: Mechanical-Narrative Synthesis
levels.description: Battle systems and progression expressing character identities

core_algorithms.name: ENSEMBLE_PROTAGONIST
core_algorithms.purpose: Construct party that collectively embodies the protagonist function
core_algorithms.pseudocode: for archetype in required_archetypes: create_character with personal_wound, thematic_function, mechanical_identity; establish relationship dynamics between all pairs; design individual arcs (introduction, development, crisis, resolution); forge party_identity through trials; return ensemble_protagonist

core_algorithms.name: SPOTLIGHT_ROTATION
core_algorithms.purpose: Manage systematic attention distribution across ensemble cast
core_algorithms.pseudocode: for each narrative_beat: if PARTY_WIDE then spotlight ALL; if location matches character.hometown then spotlight that character; if theme matches character.wound then spotlight that character; when spotlight shifts, pause previous arc and activate new one; non-spotlight characters enter REACTIVE_SUPPORT mode

core_algorithms.name: OPTIONAL_ENSEMBLE_RECONSTRUCTION
core_algorithms.purpose: Implement World of Ruin pattern where player chooses party reconstruction after catastrophe
core_algorithms.pseudocode: catastrophe.scatter(party); start with minimal_party; remaining characters have optional recruitment requiring personal quests; game completable with minimal party but full experience requires seeking each member; recruited characters contribute to final confrontation speeches

core_algorithms.name: ENSEMBLE_SAVES_PROTAGONIST
core_algorithms.purpose: Execute 'You're Not Alone' sequence where party rescues isolated protagonist
core_algorithms.pseudocode: protagonist discovers origin_trauma; protagonist withdraws and pushes away party; protagonist attempts solo progression with increasing desperation; each party member appears despite rejection and declares reason for staying; protagonist reintegrates understanding chosen_bonds > given_origin

core_algorithms.name: OPERATIC_DEATH_SCENE
core_algorithms.purpose: Construct death as emotional architecture with maximum impact
core_algorithms.pseudocode: establish character likeability and hope for future; integrate with party and player; deliver death SUDDENLY without death flags; frame as beautiful_terrible with ABSOLUTE permanence; portray party grief; remove character permanently (no resurrection); transform stakes and deepen investment

core_algorithms.name: ABILITY_IDENTITY_MAPPING
core_algorithms.purpose: Design character abilities that express who they are
core_algorithms.pseudocode: character.combat_style = f(character.background); character.special_ability = f(character.identity); mechanical uniqueness equals narrative uniqueness

core_algorithms.name: LIMIT_BREAK_DESIGN
core_algorithms.purpose: Implement crisis-identity nexus where vulnerability unlocks power
core_algorithms.pseudocode: limit_gauge fills when character takes damage; gauge enables ultimate_ability when full; limit_break expresses character's response to crisis; FURY speeds gauge, SADNESS slows it

core_algorithms.name: CLASS_CHANGE_AS_NARRATIVE
core_algorithms.purpose: Implement gameplay transformation as story transformation (Cecil paradigm)
core_algorithms.pseudocode: establish initial class with self-destructive mechanics; face trial requiring non-violence to pass; transform to new class with healing/protective abilities; reset level to 1 (genuine rebirth, not upgrade)

core_algorithms.name: HOPE_AS_DESTINATION
core_algorithms.purpose: Structure hope as earned destination after tragedy
core_algorithms.pseudocode: villain presents nihilism thesis; each party member articulates personal reason for hope; party demonstrates hope through collective action; hope components: found_family, future_possibility, meaning_through_connection, beauty_worth_preserving, redemption_possibility

core_algorithms.name: FINAL_SPEECH_PATTERN
core_algorithms.purpose: Execute final confrontation where each party member declares reason for fighting
core_algorithms.pseudocode: for each character in active_members: villain challenges meaning of existence; character responds with personal answer based on lived experience; party unites responses into collective statement; remind player of journeys, crystallize arcs, demonstrate collective strength

diagnostic_questions.question: Does each party member have a unique personal wound and arc?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Every member has distinct trauma, spotlight sequence, and resolution

diagnostic_questions.question: Do mechanical abilities express character identity?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Combat styles and special abilities reflect character backgrounds and personalities

diagnostic_questions.question: Is the emotional register sincere rather than ironic?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: High emotion is committed and genuine, not performed for show

diagnostic_questions.question: Does loss function as narrative engine rather than endpoint?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Major losses are permanent, transformative, and propel characters toward hope

diagnostic_questions.question: Does music function as co-narrator?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Leitmotifs present, themes vary with character states, unique tracks for unique moments

diagnostic_questions.question: Is spotlight systematically rotated across ensemble?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: No character monopolizes attention; each has personal spotlight moments

diagnostic_questions.question: Are cutscenes earned through gameplay investment?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Cutscenes feel like payoff or setup, never interruption

diagnostic_questions.question: Does the finale demonstrate hope as active choice?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Each character articulates reason for fighting; collective response to nihilism

maps_to: Pixar (ensemble management, emotional sincerity, found family, loss as catalyst)
Bergman (interiority via close-up, confession sequences, identity dissolution)
Opera (arias for solo expression, duets for relationships, ensembles for collective emotion, leitmotifs, spectacle as internal state)

core_operations: Construct ensemble protagonist with distributed narrative weight
Rotate spotlight systematically across party members
Design abilities that mechanically express character identity
Deploy loss as permanent, transformative narrative engine
Integrate music as co-narrator with leitmotif system
Apply operatic register with sincere high emotion
Structure hope as earned destination after tragedy
Execute final confrontation speech pattern for collective affirmation
key_constraints: Each numbered entry is reinvention, not sequel
Spectacle must serve emotional resonance, not replace it
Death must be sudden, permanent, and meaningful
Party bonds are democratic, not concentrated in single hero
Systems must feel like story, not separate from it
Operatic emotion requires sincerity, not ironic distance
Hope must be demonstrated through action, not merely declared
Player agency is bounded: high in battle/build, low in narrative outcome
